Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic text. Writing: 7 cols. on recto and 7 cols. on verso. Two texts (magical and accounts) in two different hands. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "magical spells for cure of diseases in men & cattle. The last two cols. of the verso are accounts in another hand. Date. early Ptolemaic (?). Origin. South of Egypt."
Curator's comments: Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 199.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380860) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380860)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss, split Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
